content:
You keep saying "my mind", "my life", "my opinion", "my stuff", etc.

But, these perceptions are not direct, since they are about two entities relating to eachother. So where is the singular entity (ex: you or life) that you are talking about? Can it be found?

Which is all just to say...

In the spirit of being as direct as possible, is it possible to experience any of this stuff without you? For example, not "my mind", just mind. Not "my life", just life.

If you say it is not possible, then why is that? Why are you so necessary to these perceptions? And can they even exist without your relation to them?

> Am I on the right track?

Yeah. I would say inquire into perception of time, but also maybe perception as a whole, or, the perception of thoughts and what they claim to be. Along those lines.

Try to look for or "go to" what the thought is about. If you can't, then it's just the thought, and not what it's about.

For example, go to "tomorrow" or look for the "future". 

if you're worried about tomorrow, yet you're not experiencing it, then any emotion or whatever else isn't caused by tomorrow, it's how the thought presently feels. The explaining of emotion as if it is coming from tomorrow or somewhere other than "here" is what keeps it looping.

You can "untie" yourself from symbols/thoughts by trying to go to the direct experience of what is being symbolized or thought about. When you cant, then its pretty clear there's just the symbol/thought and not what it points at.
